questions.question: What distinguishes an AI agent from a simple chatbot?
options: Agents can only respond to text
Agents can autonomously take actions and use tools
questions.explanation: AI agents are distinguished by their ability to autonomously decide and execute actions using tools, rather than just generating text responses.

questions.question: In the ReAct pattern, the agent creates a complete plan before taking any actions.
questions.explanation: ReAct alternates between reasoning and acting step-by-step. The Plan-and-Execute pattern is the one that creates a complete plan first.

questions.question: Which agent architecture uses specialized agents that collaborate on a task?
questions.explanation: Multi-Agent Systems use multiple specialized agents (e.g., researcher, writer, reviewer) that collaborate to complete complex tasks.

questions.question: What is the correct order of the agent loop?
questions.explanation: Agents follow an Observe-Think-Act loop: they first observe their environment, then reason about what to do, then take an action.

questions.question: A chatbot can call external APIs and execute code as part of its response.
questions.explanation: Standard chatbots can only generate text. Agents have the ability to call external APIs, execute code, and interact with external systems.
